Program Outcomes:
1: An ability to independently carry out research /investigation and development work to solve practical problems.
2: An ability to write and present a substantial technical report/document.
3: Students should be able to demonstrate a degree of mastery over the area as per the specialization of the program. The mastery should be at a level higher than the requirements in the appropriate bachelor program
Download Course Structure and Syllabus
Programme Specific Outcomes (PSOs):
PSO1 : Apply principles of machine design, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational methods to develop, analyze, and optimize mechanical systems using digital twin technology.
PSO2: Develop and implement digital twin models for real-time monitoring, predictive maintenance, and performance enhancement of mechanical systems in various industrial applications.
Programme Educational Objectives (PEOs): Graduates will be able to
PEO-1. Expertise in advanced machine design methodologies, computational simulations, and digital twin technologies to solve real-world engineering problems.
PEO-2. Engage in research, innovation, and technological advancements in digital twin applications, contributing to smart manufacturing, Industry 4.0, and sustainable engineering solutions.
PEO-3. Excel in leadership roles in academia, research, and industry while continuously upgrading their knowledge and skills in emerging technologies through lifelong learning and professional development.

Digital Twin Technology: Learn to develop and implement digital twin models for real-time system simulation, monitoring, and predictive maintenance.
